verses.verse: Now the Philistines <WH6430> fought <WH3898> against Israel <WH3478>; and the men <WH376> of Israel <WH3478> fled <WH5127> from before <WH6440> the Philistines <WH6430>, and fell down <WH5307> slain <WH2491> in mount <WH2022> Gilboa <WH1533>.

And the Philistines <WH6430> followed hard <WH1692> after <WH310> Saul <WH7586>, and after <WH310> his sons <WH1121>; and the Philistines <WH6430> slew <WH5221> Jonathan <WH3129>, and Abinadab <WH41>, and Malchi-shua <WH4444>, the sons <WH1121> of Saul <WH7586>.
And the battle <WH4421> went sore <WH3513> against Saul <WH7586>, and the archers <WH3384> <WH7198> hit <WH4672> him, and he was wounded <WH2342> of the archers <WH3384>.

Then said <WH559> Saul <WH7586> to his armourbearer <WH5375> <WH3627>, Draw <WH8025> thy sword <WH2719>, and thrust <WH1856> me through therewith; lest these uncircumcised <WH6189> come <WH935> and abuse <WH5953> me. But his armourbearer <WH5375> <WH3627> would <WH14> not; for he was sore <WH3966> afraid <WH3372>. So Saul <WH7586> took <WH3947> a sword <WH2719>, and fell <WH5307> upon it.
And when his armourbearer <WH5375> <WH3627> saw <WH7200> that Saul <WH7586> was dead <WH4191>, he fell <WH5307> likewise on the sword <WH2719>, and died <WH4191>.
So Saul <WH7586> died <WH4191>, and his three <WH7969> sons <WH1121>, and all his house <WH1004> died <WH4191> together <WH3162>.

And when all the men <WH376> of Israel <WH3478> that were in the valley <WH6010> saw <WH7200> that they fled <WH5127>, and that Saul <WH7586> and his sons <WH1121> were dead <WH4191>, then they forsook <WH5800> their cities <WH5892>, and fled <WH5127>: and the Philistines <WH6430> came <WH935> and dwelt <WH3427> in them.

¶ And it came to pass on the morrow <WH4283>, when the Philistines <WH6430> came <WH935> to strip <WH6584> the slain <WH2491>, that they found <WH4672> Saul <WH7586> and his sons <WH1121> fallen <WH5307> in mount <WH2022> Gilboa <WH1533>.

And when they had stripped <WH6584> him, they took <WH5375> his head <WH7218>, and his armour <WH3627>, and sent <WH7971> into the land <WH776> of the Philistines <WH6430> round about <WH5439>, to carry tidings <WH1319> unto their idols <WH6091>, and to the people <WH5971>.
And they put <WH7760> his armour <WH3627> in the house <WH1004> of their gods <WH430>, and fastened <WH8628> his head <WH1538> in the temple <WH1004> of Dagon <WH1712>.
¶ And when all Jabesh-gilead <WH3003> <WH1568> heard <WH8085> all that the Philistines <WH6430> had done <WH6213> to Saul <WH7586>,

They arose <WH6965>, all the valiant <WH2428> men <WH376>, and took away <WH5375> the body <WH1480> of Saul <WH7586>, and the bodies <WH1480> of his sons <WH1121>, and brought <WH935> them to Jabesh <WH3003>, and buried <WH6912> their bones <WH6106> under the oak <WH424> in Jabesh <WH3003>, and fasted <WH6684> seven <WH7651> days <WH3117>.

¶ So Saul <WH7586> died <WH4191> for his transgression <WH4604> which he committed <WH4603> against the LORD <WH3068>, even against the word <WH1697> of the LORD <WH3068>, which he kept <WH8104> not, and also for asking <WH7592> counsel of one that had a familiar spirit <WH178>, to inquire <WH1875> of it;
And inquired <WH1875> not of the LORD <WH3068>: therefore he slew <WH4191> him, and turned <WH5437> the kingdom <WH4410> unto David <WH1732> the son <WH1121> of Jesse <WH3448>.
